title: "Type (multi level)" field and it's description
description:
General

Below you can see the list of different type of works that support team is doing in process of work with tickets. This list represents a "Type (multi level)" field that is available in scope of each ticket. Proper types allow everybody in team to filter tickets by some particular type of work and to get some proper statistics. Also such functionality allows support to optimize their list of active tickets and exclude some tasks like "Trainings" or "Maintenances"(that are waiting for some particular day) from the active list and to avoid loss of some really urgent tickets when the list of open tickets are don't fit on a single page.

Explanation of each type

Incident - type of tickets where some problems with web configuration, calls, or billing issues are detected.

Bug - type of tickets where bug in SSP or in SMG was detected.
  SSP
    Web part
      ver. 4.4
      ver. 4.5
      Other
    OS
     ver. 4.4
     ver. 4.5
     Other
  SMG
    Web part
    OS

Question- theoretical question that doesn't require investigation, only a simple explanation of the feature and how to configure it.
   SSP
     Web part
     Server part
     Other
   SMG
     Web part
     Server part
     Other
   Other

System Alert - type of tickets that mostly arrives from client's servers and indicates some issue on server (hardware, software issue or misconfiguration).
 SSP
   Replication is broken - when support engineer gets a notification from some server about broken replication.
   Low disk space - when support engineer gets a notification from some server about
   Swap usage - when support engineer gets a notification from some server about swap usage.
   DB connections limit - when support engineer gets a notification from some server about db connections limit exceeded.
 SMG 
 Other

Provisioning - type of tickets where support team provides a newly installed SIPPY system to a new clients with all needed modules, documentations and credentials for further work with newly created billing system.
Hosted server
     SSP environment
     Trial
     Standard
     SMG for environment
     Permanent
     Other
 Hosted Dedicated server
 Dedicated server
     SSP
     SMG
 Standby
 Sandbox
 Other

Maintenance- type of tickets that includes the below tasks and in most cases requires a downtime of server during it's execution.
Hardware upgrade
SSP upgrade - this type only for SSP systems (don't use it for SMG).
     OS upgrade
     Code update
     OS and Code upgrade
SMG upgrade - maintenance for the SMG server. If update connected with SMG, please use the this type.
     OS upgrade
     Code update
     OS and Code upgrade
Customer notification - ticket that depend on other ticket where maintenance should be done and created only to notify client about maintenance in another ticket.
     Hardware upgrade
     SSP update
     OS upgrade
     Code update
     OS and Code upgrade
     SMG upgrade
Other

FeatureRequest - a simple request from any licensed client to develop something new in sippy softswitch or to improve some existing feature. In case if request is connected with improvement it is very important to investigate the case attentively to ensure that it is not a bug.

Training - the individual training for one and only one company via skype/hangouts and with screen sharing to make education more efficient.

System Crash - when server has been rebooted/crashed by some unknown reason and should be investigated or escalated.

Replication - procedure of databases synchronization between main server (that calls "Master") and backup server (that calls "Standby"). 
   Standard - standard replication could be used in cases when you need to replicate 1st environment or 1st and some non-root environments.
     Configuration - to configure and synchronize databases between Master & Standby server. When replication is configured the Standby server contains the full copy of Master database. When replication is active the Standby
                           server works only in read-only mode and can't be used for the traffic routing.In such configuration Standby uses for CDRs extraction to offload DB on master.
     Restoration - procedure that allows to restore replication after some network issues.
     Other
   Old Style - this type of replication allows to replicate some non-root environments without replication of 1st environment. Very useful when you need to replicate some non-root environment on hosted server.
     Configuration
     Restoration
     Other

Failover - the procedure of configuration of databases synchronization between Master & Standby servers with the function of automatic switchover of DB and services to Standby server when Master is down. Thus Standby can take a role of master.
   Configuration
   Manual Execution
   Automatic
   Restoration
   Testing
   Other

Migration - the procedure of migration data and services to the new hardware with all customer's patches and databases.
   Hosted client
   Dedicated client
   Other

TIB configuration - the procedure of TIB module configuration from scratch (only console part). It could be done only by support team. The needed package should be installed manually and requires additional licence for proper work.

Onboarding - type of tickets that are connected with onboarding initiation and deletion. Also something that is connected with onboarding process directly.

Licence manipulation- type of tickets where environment or server requires suspension or deletion.
   Suspend licence
   Delete licence
   Downgrade capacity
   Upgrade capacity

Feedback - type of tickets where clients are providing us some feedbacks about some articles. Usually subject is similar to this one : "Article Feedback - Understanding Authentication".

Other - other type of tickets that are not match the available types.
